prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered End Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic tube or pipe. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` - Translation Vector: `[0.0, 0.75, 0.0]` Now, draw a single 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. Include one face and one loop with the following components: - Loop 1: - Circle 1: - Center: `[0.0813, 0.0813]` - Radius: `0.0813` Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of `0.1626` using the `sketch_scale` parameter. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a distance of `0.75`. This step will generate the 3D model for part 1. Part 2: Smaller Cylindrical Object with a Cut-Out Construct a smaller cylindrical object with a cut-out, still resembling a metallic tube or pipe, but with a smaller section. Begin by creating a new coordinate system derived from the previous one as follows: - Euler Angles: `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` - Translation Vector: `[0.1054, 0.75, 0.0721]` Draw a single 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a distance of `0.1875`. This step will generate the 3D model for part 2. However, since we are using a cut-out feature for this part, make sure to use the "CutFeatureOperation" to appropriately subtract it from the preceding CAD models.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with rounded corners Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with rounded corners. Start by creating line 1 with the end points at [0.0, 0.0] and [0.75, 0.0]. Continue with line 2 from [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.625]. Then, create line 3 from [0.75, 0.625] to [0.0, 0.625]. Finally, create line 4 from [0.0, 0.625] back to [0.0, 0.0], closing the loop on face 1. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D, using the scaling parameter 0.75, euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0], and translation vector [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, using an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.5 units and no extrusion in the opposite direction. This creates a prism with the following dimensions: - Height: 0.75 units - Width: 0.5 units - Length: 0.75 units Part 2: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.75, 0.0, 0.125]. On the first face, create a loop consisting of line 1 from [0.0, 0.0] to [0.375, 0.5], line 2 from [0.375, 0.5] to [0.0, 0.5], and line 3 connecting [0.0, 0.5] back to [0.0, 0.0]. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D, using the scaling parameter 0.5, euler angles [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0], and translation vector [0.75, 0.0, 0.125]. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model by setting the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0 units and opposite normal to 0.5 units. This results in the removal of material, creating a prism with dimensions: - Height: 0.5 units - Width: 0.5 units - Length: 0.5 units</description>

Creating the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system based on the information provided: 1. Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] 2. Set the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.0848, 0.0] Creating the Sketch Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system: 1. Create the first face (face_1) by sketching on the X-Y plane. 2. Within this face, create two concentric loops (loop_1 and loop_2). 3. For loop_1, create a circle centered at [0.375, 0.375] with a radius of 0.375. 4. For loop_2, create a circle centered at [0.375, 0.375] with a radius of 0.3495. Extruding the Sketch After creating the 2D sketch, extrude it into a 3D model with the following properties: 1. Extrusion depth in the normal direction: 0.0848 2. Extrusion depth in the opposite direction: 0.0 3. Sketch scaling factor: 0.75 Part 1 Geometry Details * The height of this part is 0.75. * The width of this part is 0.0848. Part 2 Instructions Shape Create a smaller ring-shaped part to fit inside the first part, forming the donut shape. Creating the Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following information: 1. Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] 2. Set the Translation Vector to [0.0255, 0.0848, 0.0255] Creating the Sketch Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system: 1. Create the first face (face_1) by sketching on the X-Y plane. 2. Within this face, create two concentric loops (loop_1 and loop_2). 3. For loop_1, create a circle centered at [0.3495, 0.3495] with a radius of 0.3495. 4. For loop_2, create a circle centered at [0.3495, 0.3495] with a radius of 0.3394. Extruding the Sketch After creating the 2D sketch, extrude it into a 3D model with the following properties: 1. Extrusion depth in the normal direction: 0.017 2. Extrusion depth in the opposite direction: 0.0 3. Sketch scaling factor: 0.6991 Part 2 Geometry Details * The height of this part is 0.6991. * The width of this part is 0.017. These instructions should help the junior CAD designer generate accurate CAD models for both parts. The two parts, when combined, will form the desired donut shape.</description>
